reviews.review_msg: Joanna was very engaging and passionate but some of her material was hard to comprehend. The labs were a little confusing too but overall not hard to do well in her class. Many labs were just participation marks. She recorded class and uploaded the videos which was very helpful. You also get a cheat sheet for exams.

Great professor, content of the class was super interesting and engaging. All of the tests were very fair and the assignments, with really fun labs. Also lots of bonus marks during lecture in the class, which also help you to retain and learn material. Highly reccomend!
Very kind and funny prof. She cares about the class doing well and genuinely loves her job. Highly recommend.

Joanna wants everyone to do well and enjoy the content. There's bonus questions every class and she does give us more information during lectures so I would say attendance is mandatory if you want a high grade. Labs are done in groups and were really easy and fun, I don't think I will enjoy a lab in university this much ever again.

The worst course. I taught this course to myself. Nothing personally against Joanna, she might know a lot about Astronomy but she is not gifted with teaching skills. Her knowledge doesn't transfer well in the classroom, she seems confused about her concepts, she stifles through her slides like she doesn't know what her slides entail. Never again

Easy course with an easy prof. If you want a good grade, go to lectures and do a little bit of review. She's incredibly passionate about her field which makes lectures very engaging. She's great in so many ways, there's not even enough text to be able to fit it all. You've seen the ratings, just take her if you are at all interested :)

Joanna is incredibly nice and her lectures are always super interesting and filled with lots of puns. She lets you use a cheat sheet for all of the 3 terms tests which are fairly easy if you do the homework and go to the labs (which are actually fun). I had a great time in her course and learnt so much.

- Joanna was very friendly and caring and looked like she genuinely liked teaching.
- The lectures were interesting and helped a lot in preparation for the tests.
- As long as you did the homework, she allowed a cheat sheet for every test so it was not too difficult to get a high mark.
- If you don't know much about astronomy I highly recommend.

Joanna is awesome. She has amazing lectures and kept the class engaged by doing lecture polls and bringing enthusiasm daily. For exams, just remember the important formulas and info from the lecture slides.

Joanna is a great professor, I looked forward to attending her class even though it was the only class that I had that day. She makes her lectures really interested and keeps her students on her toes by having her lecture polls which are worth ~bonus~ marks!! She lets you have cheat sheets for quizterms which were honestly lifesavers for me.

Joanna is wonderful! She never judges anybody for asking questions. She is also extremely generous with the in-class poll bonus. Her passion for astronomy is obvious. Couldn't have asked for a better professor! If you have ANY questions, go to her office hours. Also, be prepared for a lot of bad (but funny) astronomy jokes!

Joanna has made this class very fun. She cares about her students and wants everyone to learn and do well. She records her lectures which was a huge help to watch back and study from. The class isn't easy, but if you put in some work even I got a good mark. Very knowledgeable prof and great person. I wish all my profs were as good as her.

Kind professor. Class was graded perfectly with 5 homework assignments, a few group assignments, and 3 midterms (of which only the top 2 counted). Bonus of up to 5% of grade by doing daily polls in class. Incredibly passionate about her field and supplied daily images of space to the class before we started.

She's a great prof, super caring and a fair grader. She wants her students to do well as it is a reflection of her teaching! She is very clear about what will be on the midterms and gives plenty of examples. Some problems on the exams come straight from the homework so do your review. 10/10 a great professor!
Joanna's care for students and enthusiasm made her lectures enjoyable. Material is not too difficult and only involves very simple math. The homework and tests were completely fair. Great course.
Great class and enthusiasm but her slides are too broad and hard to follow

She is an amazing prof, took the time to explain complicated topics and ensured all students understood the concepts. One of the best I've had at SFU, gave plenty of opportunities for additional learning :) Physics is one of my weaker subjects and I still managed to enjoy lectures

Joanna was one of the best instructors I ever had! very thoughtful and she tried to make physics easy as much as possible. She gave a relatively good amount of homework and assignments, which had 2 benefits: 1) You had many opportunities to boost your grade. & 2)You had so many extra (and optional) practice questions to work on.

The best prof you will get for physics! Attending lectures and getting poll questions 100% right means an extra 5% in the overall grade. Cares a lot about her students, and even let us do some questions of the midterm at home for extra credit. The course isn't easy, and requires a lot of extra practice, but she gave all the resources. Tip: Read TB!

fun class i'd recommend it to anyone! goes surprisingly in-depth on a lot of things but joanna has kept the math/physics side of things very easy-to-understand with proportionalities and approximations. this was my favourite class this semester in terms of how much new and exciting stuff i learned!

Joanna was decent. PHYS 101 isn't one of her favourite courses, as she is more into her astronomy course. She would often confuse herself and get lost during lecture, in turn causing us to become lost as well. She was very caring and gave 5% bonus for poll questions during class. Final exam was heavily scaled, and class average final grade was a B

Very passionate prof who really cares about her students learning. Lectures were generally easy to understand, lots of opportunities for free bonus marks which can bump you up a letter grade. Homework & labs were easy, she also provided practice exams which were great. There was little math but she overcomplicated it which seemed to confuse some.

Probably my favourite prof ever. Extremely nice and explains concepts well. Tons of free marks available. Exams are open book, so make sure you use the textbook during quizzes. The math is as easy as it gets for any Q-course.

Prof Joanna was very nice. She provided very entertaining lectures. Her labs were very easy to do and if you showed up you should be able to get an easy A in all of them. Never did the greatest in my homework/quizzes and managed to get a decent mark. I would recommend this course to her if you need to meet any requirements.
I enjoyed this class. She was very caring and generous so you should try your best and appreciate her. Do all the practice problems lol

Great at everything except writing finals. Her mc for midterms were easy and most q were not bad or from her notes. But midterms didnt have much time. The final was a completely diff story. She contributed mainly the last chapters. It had avg of 50 and extremely difficult to understand what she was asking us to do. I enjoyed the class though.

Take This call with Joanna No Question about it. Best Physics prof thus far in my 2.5 yrs at Simon Fraser. She actually cares (unlike many others at sfu) about her students learning, and academic progress. Her lectures are rich in detail, and she makes them extreeemley entertaining for physics lectures with her awesome personality and fun demos.

Joanna is an amazing and genuinely caring prof. I took this course for a Q requirement and although I despise math and physics, Joanna made it accessible and her passion made me care even more for the course content. Overall, this course was a great intro into space and a refresher on basic math concepts that my art-student self had forgotten!

She is truly one of the best profs I have had until now. She is really passionate about the material she teaches, which really show through her lectures. Although I never really enjoyed physics, I was able to really see it through a different lens this semester, just by the way this course was taught.

Prof. Woo is one of my favourite profs at SFU by far. She gives very clear assignments, and has engaging lectures. She also did discord hours instead of office hours which was way better in my opinion. Overall you can tell she cares about the students, and wants them too succeed. Take this class if you have the chance too.
her course format was really helpful in learning physics. just the right amount of homework, plus she gave you opportunities to improve your grade

Taking this course as an elective with Joanna was the best thing I did. She is such a kind, caring and genuine professor, that you can't believe. Her exams were completely fair, and not difficult at all. She's the kind of prof who actually cares about students learning the concept instead of giving them a hard time with difficult tests.

Took this course because I was told there was not much math (Joanna said this at the very beginning) and I needed a lab course for my PDP requirement. Breezes through complicated subject matter very quickly+overcomplicates matter that was very easily explained by an external tutor. She spends a lot of time on stuff thats unimportant like cool pics.

Joanna Woo is a great prof but doesn't give a lot of practices with the math involved, but otherwise will explain things better if you ask. Every week there is at least a lab, homework, or a quizterm due. Lots to keep track of
Sweetest prof, very considerate and very good at explaining and connecting concepts

She's literally doing what a true teacher do. She inspired us and made her lectures really interesting to follow. Labs and homework overall were fair, they helped me to prepare for my quizterms. No final exam. However, decent effort is still needed if you want to get a good grade.

Loved this class! She's really into astronomy. Not that much math required, and whatever was required, she explained in detail until the class understood. Had polls throughout the lecture, which were really easy if you paid attention. Textbook was helpful. Tests were average. I had two short essays instead of a final exam.

She is very organized and is great at explaining stuff with and without physical proof. The midterms were kinda easy, but the final exam was brutally hard. There was a lot of homework, about 4,5 hours a week, but the homework was were helpful. Overall, a good class with a good prof.

Midterms very fair, but the final was EXTREMLY hard! Attendance is mandatory if you wanna get iclicker marks. Her teaching skills and method is amazing!! She's very good at carefully going through the concepts and explaining everything very well via doing example questions with the class. She has midterm reviews (some review Q came in that midterm

Wasn't sure about Joanna since she was a new professor, but I loved the way she explained things. I took more notes from the textbook than hers, and did all the hw she assigned. It was DEFINITELY hw heavy (around 3 hours for online hw every week) but they helped me write a good midterm. Final was brutal though... she loves her Road Runner problems.

Did not like the format of the class. Found myself spending the class hurrying to hand write her notes rather than take in the material. Wouldve preferred either recorded lectures, or pre-posted notes to aid in understanding. Definitely passionate in the material, but found the class to still be hard to understand.

She's new and a lot of times she was discovering how to do things. I don't think she's a bad teacher just needs some experience. She also sometimes doesn't answer the questions asked, properly. But she's very nice and caring. She wants you to do well.

The way she ran the class gave room for potential grade increase that was not test dependent. With regard to her teaching she could spend more time going through examples and less time deriving equations. Rarely did class examples and if she did she always ran out if class time and would rush through the question and was difficult to understand.

Shes clearly a new prof, does everything by "the books". Not a good lecturer, not terrible either. Class was un-enjoyable and had a bad flow. Spends too much time deriving equations and does not go through examples in class. Shes confused about what to put on the exams and exam difficulty is inconsistent. Over all not great, worse than the average.

She is new to teaching, and you can already tell she enjoys her job and wants you to do well. The class lectures were pretty interesting sometimes. Homework is a must. If you focus on the homework you will do well on the exams.

Joanna is a very kind and knowledgable physics prof. Physics is often a difficult subject, yet she is able to make it enjoyable and help you grasp the many concepts. She often throws in some puns to lighten the mood, and loves going into detail about astrophysics (very passionate). She wants you to do well in the class, and it shows! Amazing prof!

Lectures are well-structured and easy to follow and she will routinely stop and ask for questions. When questions are asked she does a good job of addressing them. Follows the course textbook closely and emphasizes the important things during lectures. HW is from the textbook and exams have similar questions.
